page.title: 01SYDLING ST NICHOLAS.
page.content: Sydling is situated in a valley and is a small village of about 350 people. There is also a small settlement on Up Sydling farm. There are no factories, one church, one pub and one small post office. The village hall is well used and was built in 1939. The spring that flows through the village rises at Up Sydling. People have been living in this area since Celtic times. Most of the land is owned by the farmers who keep live stock and grow mostly cereal crops. It is not easy land to farm because of the hills. Until this year Sydling was owned by Winchester College but now all they have left are small pockets of land and most of all the old barns. These they are selling to builders for developement.
